channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 2 lime bikes thrown over railing, 18th February
item.description:
2 lime bikes thrown over the railings near the war memorial at The Point. Been there since Tuesday 17th

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Maidenstone Hill, Greenwich

item.title: Road defect, 18th February
item.description:

item.title: Unlicensed mechanic doing street side repairs, 18th February
item.description:
Mechanic currently doing streetside repairs on commercial basis, leaving oil spills, debris and mess all over the public road and pavement. Drove both vehicles here so neither of them are damaged enough for emergency repairs. This work should be carried out in a commercial garage premises, not on the public highway leaving clean up costs to be funded by taxpayers.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 66, Lennard Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Steele Walk between 1- 8 dogs mess, 18th February
item.description:
People are continuously allowing their dogs to mess on Steele Walk. Steele Walk needs cleaning with disinfectant and stencils put down with a matter of urgency.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Sussex Road, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Road, West Heath, Greater London

item.title: First lamp post out on Belton ROad, 18th February

item.title: Speeding, 18th February
item.description:
Newlands Park is designated as 20 mph but the amount of cars,buses,motorbikes and Lorrie’s breaking that limit is rediculous. Road needs speed ramps or cameras erected.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Newlands Park, Perry Vale, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Smashed Glass in the alleyway, 18th February
item.description:
The Alleyway near 150 Sevenoaks Way which goes through to Pleasance Rd / Vernons Close has broken glass all over the pavement which happens on a regular basis and so needs clearing on a regular basis because it’s a well used alleyway for pedestrians and dog walkers .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Pleasance Road, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubble left in road, 18th February
item.description:
Pavement was repaired outside 94 Newlands Park and was finished over 2 weeks ago but the excess rubble and bollards have been left in the road causing traffic mayhem. Needs to be removed asap
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Newlands Park, Perry Vale, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
